name: Triple Rock Apartments

google_reviews.author: Fievel Mousekewitz
google_reviews.review:
The new-construction units are rather roomy for a studio, but pricey.

Electricians have had to come three times in six months to repeatedly replace bad breakers.

PTLA took over from Local Property Management, took weeks to figure out who actually was allowed to park in the garage, and towed my car because the only spots left for paying tenants to park were also booked with the Realty company downstairs. They don't seem interested in reimbursing for the $364 tow.

ownerResponse.text:
Thank you for your feedback. We are sorry that you have not been pleased with your experience at our community so far. 

Although occasionally maintenance concerns may arise at any property, our team is committed to responding and communicating quickly to resolve these concerns. The electrical maintenance concerns we experienced have been addressed, and we do not anticipate any further issues. 

We have a number of parking spaces reserved for commercial tenants, and we ask that residents not park in those spaces during business hours out of respect for those tenants. Our team provides warnings before towing, but unfortunately, if a vehicle is not moved, it may result in towing.

We would be happy to speak with you regarding your concerns. Please give our office a call at your earliest convenience.

The Good

The recent construction at Triple Rock Apartments has yielded units that users find to be spacious, especially for studio configurations. The appeal of a roomy space in an apartment is not to be underestimated, which could be particularly enticing for those seeking out their first apartment or moving from more confined living arrangements.

Despite a small pool of user reviews, it's clear that those who have settled into the newer units find the size for the value to be noteworthy. Such spaciousness may contribute to a more comfortable and enjoyable living experience, assuming other factors within the property management's control are up to par.

The Great

Communication from the property management has shown a degree of responsiveness, as evidenced by the property's engagement with user reviews. The management's willingness to provide public replies demonstrates their commitment to addressing tenant concerns and the importance they place on maintaining an open line of dialogue.

In the event of maintenance issues, such as the electrical challenges mentioned in the user reviews, the management asserts a commitment to quick response times and thorough resolution of problems. A proactive approach to maintenance concerns is crucial in property management and can greatly influence tenant satisfaction levels.

The Bad

Despite the spaciousness of the new units, the user review highlights a significant issue with the electrical fixtures that necessitate repeated attention. Having to call electricians multiple times within a short span can prove to be not only an inconvenience but also raises questions about the overall quality of the construction and maintenance protocols.

Additionally, the transition in property management from Local Property Management to PTLA appears to have led to confusion and miscommunication, specifically regarding parking arrangements. It's distressing for tenants to face uncertainties about something as fundamental as where they can park, especially when paying for the privilege.

The Ugly

Parking has evolved into a major point of contention for at least one resident, culminating in the towing of their vehicle and a hefty fine. The described scenario indicates a lack of clarity in policy enforcement and poor communication between the property management and its tenants. A $364 tow fee is not a trivial matter and has left the resident dissatisfied with the management's handling of the situation.

Furthermore, the refusal or disinterest on the part of the property management to reimburse the affected tenant for the tow charge has likely exacerbated the situation, potentially damaging trust and the otherwise professional tenant-management relationship. It is incidents like these that can tarnish the reputation of the property management company.
